entry.et: Middle English, from Old English; akin to Old High German hant hand

def.dt: :the terminal part of the vertebrate forelimb when modified (as in humans) as a grasping organ
:the forelimb segment (as the terminal section of a bird's wing) of a vertebrate higher than the fishes that corresponds to the hand irrespective of its form or functional specialization
:a part serving the function of or resembling a hand: as
:the hind foot of an ape
:the chela of a crustacean
:something resembling a hand: as
:an indicator or pointer on a dialect the hands of a clock
:index 5
:a cluster of bananas developed from a single flower group
:a branched rootstock of ginger
:a bunch of large leaves (as of tobacco) tied together usually with another leaf
:personal possession usually used in plural the documents fell into the hands of the enemy
:control supervision usually used in plural left the matter in her hands
:side direction men fighting on either hand
:one of two sides or aspects of an issue or argument on the one hand we can appeal for peace, and on the other, declare war
:a pledge especially of betrothal or bestowal in marriage
:style of penmanship :handwriting wrote in a fancy hand
:signature
:skill ability tried her hand at sailing
:an instrumental part had a hand in the victory
:a unit of measure equal to 4 inches (10.2 centimeters) used especially for the height of horses
:assistance or aid especially involving physical effort lend a hand
:participation interest had no hand in the decision
:a round of applause
:a player in a card game or board game
:the cards or pieces held by a player
:a single round in a game
:the force or solidity of one's position (as in negotiations) trying to strengthen their hand
:a person who performs or executes a particular work two portraits by the same hand
:a person employed at manual labor or general tasks a ranch hand
:worker employee employed over a hundred hands
:a member of a ship's crew all hands on deck
:a person skilled in a particular action or pursuit
:a specialist or veteran in a usually designated activity or region a China hand
:handiwork doings
:style of execution :workmanship the hand of a master
:the feel of or tactile reaction to something (as silk or leather)
:a punch made with a specified hand knocked him out with a good right hand
:near in time or place :within reach use whatever ingredients are at hand
:currently receiving or deserving attention the business at hand
:by or through the action of
:with the hands or a hand-worked implement (as a tool or pen) rather than with a machine
:from one individual directly to another deliver the document by hand
:in one's possession or control had matters well in hand with money in hand
:in preparation
:under consideration
:everywhere
:in present possession or readily available kept supplies on hand
:about to appear :pending
:in attendance :present
:in one's possession or care too much time on my hands
:without delay or deliberation
:in a summary or peremptory manner rejected the plan out of hand
:done with :finished
:out of control
:with the hands fruit eaten out of hand
:into possession the letter … has come to hand George Washington
:within reach
:with the hands rather than by machine
:to touch or manage with the hands
:to deal with
:furl
:to lead, guide, or assist with the hand hand a lady into a bus
:to give, pass, or transmit with the hand hand a letter to her
:to present or provide with handed him a surprise
:to give credit to :concede the excellence of
(Billings) Learned 1872–1961 Am. jurist
:totally assiduously
:a short-handled ax intended for use with one hand
:a prehistoric stone tool having one end pointed for cutting and the other end rounded for holding in the hand
:immersion blender
:an emergency brake operated by a hand lever
:to transmit in succession (as from father to son)
:to make official formulation of and express (the opinion of a court)
:to feed (as animals) by hand
